indiana_jones.role: Protagonist; an adventurous archaeologist who drives the action through his quest to retrieve the Sankara Stones and save the children enslaved by the Thuggee cult.
indiana_jones.backstory: A renowned archaeologist and professor, Indiana Jones is known for his daring exploits and extensive knowledge of ancient artifacts. He is often drawn into dangerous situations due to his quest for historical treasures and his strong sense of justice.
indiana_jones.strengths: Highly intelligent, resourceful, skilled in hand-to-hand combat, proficient with a whip, and possesses an encyclopedic knowledge of ancient history and languages.
indiana_jones.weaknesses: Impulsive, can be reckless, has a fear of snakes, and sometimes allows his desire for artifacts ('fortune and glory') to overshadow immediate practical concerns.
indiana_jones.psychology: High in Openness (curious and inventive), Conscientiousness (responsible and hardworking), and Extraversion (assertive and energetic). Moderate in Agreeableness (sometimes abrasive) and Neuroticism (prone to anxiety in stressful situations).
indiana_jones.beliefs: Believes in the preservation of history and cultural artifacts, the fight against oppression, and the pursuit of knowledge. Has a deep respect for different cultures and traditions.
indiana_jones.motivations: Driven by a desire to protect and preserve historical artifacts, seek out adventure, and combat evil forces. His personal code of ethics and his past experiences shape his determination.
indiana_jones.social_dynamics: Often operates as a leader, gaining the loyalty and respect of his companions. Has a complex relationship with his romantic interests, marked by mutual attraction and frequent conflicts.
indiana_jones.arc: Over the course of the story, Indiana transitions from a focus on personal gain ('fortune and glory') to a more altruistic mission of saving the children and restoring the village's prosperity.

willie_scott.role: Sidekick; a nightclub singer who becomes Indiana Jones' reluctant companion and love interest.
willie_scott.backstory: Willie is a glamorous American singer performing in Shanghai when she is inadvertently drawn into Indiana Jones' adventure. She is initially out of her element and resistant to the dangers they face.
willie_scott.strengths: Charismatic, resourceful in her own way, and capable of unexpected bravery when pushed to the limit.
willie_scott.weaknesses: Prone to panic, often whines, and is initially self-centered and materialistic. Her high-maintenance personality often clashes with the rough conditions of their adventure.
willie_scott.psychology: High in Neuroticism (easily stressed and emotional) and Extraversion (sociable and lively). Moderate in Openness (adventurousness grows over time) and Agreeableness (becomes more cooperative). Low in Conscientiousness (initially irresponsible).
willie_scott.beliefs: Initially focused on her own safety and comfort. As the story progresses, she develops a greater sense of empathy and courage.
willie_scott.motivations: Initially motivated by a desire to return to her comfortable life, but gradually driven by a desire to support Indiana and the children they aim to rescue.
willie_scott.social_dynamics: Often clashes with Indiana due to their different priorities and personalities but grows to trust and care for him deeply. Her relationship with Short Round is initially distant but becomes more affectionate.
willie_scott.arc: Willie evolves from a self-absorbed performer to a brave and supportive ally, finding inner strength and resilience she didn't know she had.

short_round.role: Sidekick; a resourceful and loyal young boy who assists Indiana Jones throughout the adventure.
short_round.backstory: An orphan from Shanghai, Short Round is fiercely independent and has survived on the streets by his wits. He idolizes Indiana and is fiercely loyal to him.
short_round.strengths: Clever, agile, and courageous beyond his years. Skilled in driving and mechanics, and quick to adapt to new situations.
short_round.weaknesses: His youth and small stature can be a disadvantage in physical confrontations. He is also deeply attached to Indiana, sometimes to the point of recklessness.
short_round.psychology: High in Openness (creative and curious), Conscientiousness (dependable and diligent), and Agreeableness (friendly and cooperative). Moderate in Extraversion (sociable but can be cautious) and low in Neuroticism (generally calm under pressure).
short_round.beliefs: Believes in loyalty, friendship, and doing the right thing. Looks up to Indiana as a role model and mentor.
short_round.motivations: Driven by a desire to help Indiana, prove his own worth, and find a sense of belonging and purpose.
short_round.social_dynamics: Acts as a surrogate son to Indiana, forming a close bond with him. His relationship with Willie evolves from indifference to genuine affection as they face dangers together.
short_round.arc: Short Round's bravery and resourcefulness grow throughout the story, solidifying his place as a key member of the team and proving that even a young boy can make a significant impact.

mola_ram.role: Antagonist; the high priest of the Thuggee cult, seeking to use the Sankara Stones to gain power and dominate India.
mola_ram.backstory: A devout and fanatical leader of the Thuggee cult, Mola Ram is dedicated to reviving the ancient practices of human sacrifice and worship of the goddess Kali.
mola_ram.strengths: Charismatic and persuasive, with a deep knowledge of dark rituals and a fanatical devotion to his cause. Commands a large following and instills fear in both his enemies and followers.
mola_ram.weaknesses: His overconfidence and fanaticism can blind him to the resilience and ingenuity of his opponents. His reliance on rituals and supernatural beliefs makes him vulnerable to practical challenges.
mola_ram.psychology: High in Openness (innovative in his malevolence) and Neuroticism (prone to extreme emotions). Low in Conscientiousness (morally unscrupulous) and Agreeableness (ruthless and manipulative). Moderate in Extraversion (charismatic leader).
mola_ram.beliefs: Believes in the absolute power of Kali and the necessity of human sacrifice to restore the cult's dominance. He sees himself as the chosen instrument of the goddess's will.
mola_ram.motivations: Driven by a desire for power, control, and the revival of the Thuggee cult. His actions are fueled by his belief in his divine mission.
mola_ram.social_dynamics: Commands fear and loyalty from his followers. His interactions with Indiana and the others are marked by intimidation and violence.
mola_ram.arc: Mola Ram's single-minded pursuit of power leads to his downfall. His inability to foresee the resilience of his enemies and his underestimation of their resourcefulness ultimately result in his demise.
